greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A115384(A277812(n)) = index of the row where n is located in array A277880.
comment: a(n) = index of the first odious number which is encountered when we start from k = n and iterate the map k -> A003188(A006068(k)/2).
This works as a left inverse of A000069 like also does A115384.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
xref: Cf. A003945 (the positions of 1's in this sequence).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 03 2016
